Utility modules#

The utility module contains various convenience functions. A separate visualization module allows for the visual inspection of the optimization setup and results.

optim.utils.utils#

Utility module.

optim.utils.utils.filter_info(info: Dict) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, Dict]#

Filter the contact info of a contact information dictionary.

Dispatch function for general contact info dicts. Since the gripper type is given as a string and not as an object, we do not use a proper singledispatch.

Parameters

info – Contact information dictionary.

Returns

The initial gripper configuration for the optimization and the filtered contact info.

Raises

KeyError – Gripper type is not supported.

optim.utils.utils.check_grasp(info: Dict) → bool#

Check if the current grasp constitutes a valid configuration.

Parameters

info – Contact information dictionary.

Returns

True if the grasp is an optimization initialization candidate, else False.

Raises

AssertionError – Contact info contains an unsupported gripper type.

optim.utils.utils.import_guard() → bool#

Check if type checking is active or sphinx is trying to build the docs.

Returns

True if either type checking is active or sphinx builds the docs, else False.

optim.utils.rotations#

Rotations module to extend the envs.rotations module by JAX differentiable conversions.

optim.utils.rotations.quat2mat(q: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray#

Convert a single quaternion to a rotation matrix.

Reimplementation of envs.rotations to make it compatible with JAX automatic differentiation.

Parameters

q – Quaternion.

Returns

The rotation matrix as JAX array.

optim.visualizations#

optim.visualization.visualize_geometry(geom: optim.geometry.base_geometry.Geometry)#

Visualize dispatch function for geometries.

Parameters

geom – Geometry.

Raises

TypeError – Default dispatcher means an unsupported geometry has been used.

optim.visualization.visualize_gripper(gripper, fig: matplotlib.figure.Figure, color: str = '#777777') → matplotlib.figure.Figure#

Dispatch function for plotting a gripper.

Parameters

  • gripper – Gripper.

  • fig – Optional figure to plot into.

  • color – Optional matplotlib compatible color string.

Returns

The figure.

Raises

RuntimeError – Gripper type is not supported.

optim.visualization.visualize_contacts(con_pts: List[Dict], fig: Optional[matplotlib.figure.Figure] = None) → matplotlib.figure.Figure#

Visualize the contact points.

Only plots into a figure. plt.show has to be invoked manually.

Parameters

  • con_pts – Contact point list.

  • fig – Optional figure to plot the contact points into. Allows to plot multiple objects.

Returns

The figure.
